repnme.cdata!:
Azerbaijan - Second Structural Adjustment
            Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project ratings are as follows :
            Project outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is overall satisfactory; and Borrower
            performance is overall satisfactory.  Among the lessons
            learned are the following:  1) lending can be a powerful
            instrument even for countries that do not need Bank's
            financing for immediate balance of payments or budget
            purposes; 2) An ambitious, complex, and demanding agenda (as
            in the case of SAC-II) seeking to accomplish extensive
            behavioral changes in a transition economy in a short period
            of time necessitates a trusting partnership between the Bank
            team and the Government's counterparts on the one hand;
            and on the other, consistency of advice and coordination of
            efforts amongst multilateral agencies and bilateral donorsl;
            3) Government ownership of policy reforms is a dynamic
            concept; it can reinforce itself or dwindle over time also
            frequent Bank-country dialogue with the continuity and
            dedication of a well-coordinated country team throughout the
            tenure of the program helps to reinforce the
            Government's commitment; and 4) Programmatic assistance
            (as contemplated by the PRSP process) should not be viewed
            just as medium-term and time-bound external support.
            Adjustment operations can play a crucial integrative role in
            paving the way for sector projects in achieving the
            necessary high-level decisions and providing the appropriate
            legal and strategic policy framework.

5085416.trustfund:
TF038056-AZERBAIJAN - STRUCTURAL
            ADJUSTMENT CREDIT,TF025389-PHRD-STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT
            CREDIT (SAC) II
5085416.majtheme: Public sector governance,Financial and private sector development,Economic management

repnme.cdata!:
Azerbaijan - Second Structural Adjustment
            Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Structural Adjustment Credit
            (SAC II) follows a significant intensification of the
            Government of Azerbaijan's reform efforts over the past
            two years and is intended to bolster and deepen those
            efforts. The credit aims to enhance the Govenrment's
            ability to manage Azaerbaijan's natural resource boom
            efficiently, and to stimulate balanced economic growth, job
            creation, and poverty reduction. This SAC II credit is
            expected to bolster reforms that clearly define the role of
            the state and at the same time eliminate impediments to
            growth and employment in the non-oil sectors. The reform
            program, supported by the SAC II credit will: 1) improve
            transparency and accountability in public financial
            management, including the establishment of the supreme audit
            institution; 2) strengthen the tracking of poverty-reducing
            public expenditures, and monitoring of their impact on
            poverty; 3) improve strategic priority setting and
            transparency of medium-term public expenditure and
            investment programs; 4) introduce transparency and financial
            discipline in the energy sector, including fiscalization of
            quasi-fiscal activities; 5) reduce conflicts of interest and
            corruption in the business environment, including regulation
            enforcement, separation of regulatory and commercial
            functions, and tax and customs; 6) improve transparency,
            financial discipline, and competition in the banking sector;
            and 7) improve the privatization process. The credit will be
            disbursed in two equal tranches.
